title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Instructional Design and Neuroimaging Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Adult Education Principles, Cognitive Psychology Fundamentals, and Instructional Design Methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners with field experience applying neuroscience-based instructional design techniques to improve workplace efficiency

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more measurement methods for different types of cognitive load (intrinsic/extraneous/germane).
Learners can design a two-stage or more cognitive load analysis procedure using neuroimaging techniques such as fMRI/EEG.
Learners can propose strategies to reduce extraneous load by 20% or more when designing educational programs based on cognitive load theory.
Learners can develop an evaluation system that combines neuroimaging data with traditional measurement tools (surveys, performance analysis).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
